title: What is the best language for song? - Quora

response.answer_text: Spanish. I have little knowledge of the language, so my opinion is not biased by my investment in the language. But it was influenced by attending Zumba classes. The Zumba instructors are actually required to choose more songs in Spanish than other languages and I can hear why. French is sometimes mentioned as the most beautiful language to hear, but for music, Spanish seems to have the best qualities. I think it’s because the consonants are used in a way good for rhythmic effects and the vowels are good for tones. I formed this opinion before finding this: Which Language Makes the Best Music- POLL In that poll English beats Spanish, but probably because it was given in English. Spanish easily beat the other languages. Here’s more evidence: 7 Foreign-Language Songs That Have Topped The US Charts | Babbel Note: Asian languages with tones such as Mandarin have disadvantages for writing lyrics because the tones of the words and melody can conflict. It’s trickier to compose songs with those languages.
﻿Italian, If you listen to an Italians speak you sometimes think they're singing. Can there be anything more beautiful than this...
